snippet: In chronicling the end of a marriage, “The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby” crosses a landscape mined with loss, secrets and questions of identity.
abstract: A O Scott reviews movie The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby, written and directed by Ned Benson and starring Jessica Chastain and James McAvoy.
lead_paragraph: In chronicling the end of a marriage, “The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby” crosses a landscape mined with loss, secrets and questions of identity.

headline.print_headline: When Sorrow Is Deeper Than Love
headline.seo: ‘The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby,’ by Ned Benson
headline.main: When Sorrow Is Deeper Than Love
headline.kicker: Movie Review | ‘The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby’
